description: A comprehensive personal portfolio website designed to showcase professional projects, skills, and experience to potential employers, clients, and collaborators. It includes a dynamic blog and AI-powered project recommendations.
purpose: To serve as an online professional hub, providing a dynamic and engaging platform for individuals to present their work, professional background, contact information, and share insights through a blog, enhanced by personalized project recommendations.
target_audience: General Public interested in the individual's work and blog content

tech_stack.frontend: Modern JavaScript Framework (e.g., React, Next.js, Vue, Svelte) for dynamic UI and potentially server-side rendering/static site generation.
tech_stack.backend: Node.js (Express/NestJS), Python (Django/Flask), Go, or PHP (Laravel) for API and CMS integration, handling blog content and AI recommendation service calls.
tech_stack.database: Relational (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) or NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB, Firestore) depending on content structure and scalability needs, storing projects, skills, blog posts, etc.
tech_stack.cms: Headless CMS (e.g., Strapi, Directus, Contentful) or custom built for content management of projects, skills, and blog posts.
tech_stack.file_storage: Cloud-based object storage (e.g., AWS S3, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob Storage) for media assets, including blog images and project screenshots.

architecture_components.description: The user-facing website, built with a modern framework, responsible for rendering UI, routing, and interacting with backend APIs to display projects, skills, and blog posts.
architecture_components.technologies_hint: React, Next.js, Vue.js, Svelte, Tailwind CSS

architecture_components.description: Provides API endpoints for dynamic content (projects, skills, blog posts), contact form submissions, and interacting with the CMS and AI recommendation service.
Stores all structured data including projects, skills, blog posts, and CMS user data.
Hosts static assets like project images, profile pictures, blog post images, and downloadable resumes/CVs.
architecture_components.technologies_hint: AWS S3, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob Storage, Cloudinary

architecture_components.description: An administrative interface for content creators to manage projects, skills, blog posts, and other website content without coding.
Handles sending emails for contact form submissions directly from the website.
External service providing personalized project recommendations based on visitor behavior or interests.
architecture_components.technologies_hint: Third-party AI API (e.g., custom ML model, existing recommendation engine API)

architecture_components.description: Embeds a script or uses an API to track website traffic, user behavior, and engagement across all sections, including blog and project views.

hosting_platform.frontend: Vercel, Netlify, AWS Amplify, Firebase Hosting (for static/serverless deployments)
hosting_platform.backend_database: AWS (EC2, RDS, Lambda), Google Cloud Platform (Compute Engine, Cloud SQL, Cloud Functions), Azure (App Service, SQL Database, Functions), Heroku, DigitalOcean

security_considerations.description: Strict validation for all user inputs (e.g., contact forms, CMS entries for projects/blog posts) to prevent injection attacks (SQLi, XSS).
Secure authentication for CMS users (e.g., bcrypt for password hashing, JWT for session management) and role-based access control for managing content.
Protecting API endpoints with rate limiting, proper error handling, and secure API keys/tokens for external services like the AI recommendation service and email service.
Storing sensitive information (API keys, database credentials) securely using environment variables, not hardcoding them.
Enforcing HTTPS for all traffic to encrypt data in transit and ensure secure communication.
Implementing CSP to mitigate cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks by restricting which sources content can be loaded from, especially important for dynamic content and third-party scripts.

scalability_considerations.description: Utilizing a Content Delivery Network (CDN) for images, videos, and other static files (including project screenshots and blog images) to improve loading times and reduce server load.
Implementing proper database indexing, query optimization, and potentially read replicas for high traffic scenarios, especially for content-heavy sections like projects and blog posts.
Implementing caching mechanisms (e.g., Redis, in-memory cache) for frequently accessed data or API responses, suchs as popular projects or recent blog posts.
Using serverless functions for backend logic (e.g., contact form submission, AI recommendation requests) to scale automatically based on demand.

monitoring_logging.description: Tools to monitor application health, response times, and identify bottlenecks (e.g., Sentry, New Relic, Datadog), especially crucial for backend API and AI service integrations.
Centralized logging for application errors and exceptions to facilitate quick debugging and issue resolution (e.g., ELK Stack, Loggly, CloudWatch Logs).
External services to continuously check website availability and notify administrators of downtime (e.g., UptimeRobot, Pingdom).
Leveraging analytics tools to monitor traffic, user behavior, and content performance across all sections including project views and blog post reads.

ci_cd.description: Setting up continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to automate testing and deployments upon code changes (e.g., GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD, CircleCI).
Maintaining separate environments for development, staging (testing), and production to ensure changes are thoroughly vetted before going live.
Using Git for version control to track code changes and facilitate collaborative development.

integrations.description: API integration for dynamic project recommendations based on user interaction or pre-defined logic.
Client-side script integration for tracking website visitors, page views, and user behavior, including interactions with projects and blog posts.
API integration for sending contact form submissions and other transactional emails.
Optional integration to display recent social media activity or dynamically link profiles.
Integration with tools like Google Search Console for monitoring search performance, especially for blog articles and portfolio projects.
